intro: Centauridium, commonly known as the centaur's foot, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It consists of several species, most of which are native to southern Africa. The plants are characterized by their hairy stems and clusters of small, daisy-like flowers. They typically grow in dry, rocky habitats and are adapted to arid conditions. Centauridium species are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits.
